summary: This document consists of multiple 30-minute inmate check sheets from the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, dated July 30, 2019. The sheets record staff signatures confirming visual checks of inmates in locked-down status, following a protocol requiring observation at least twice per hour. The document is significant as it pertains to the period when Jeffrey Epstein was incarcerated at MCC New York prior to his death.

events.title: Inmate Monitoring at MCC New York SHU
events.description: Routine 30-minute visual checks of inmates held in the Special Housing Unit (administrative detention or disciplinary segregation) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, were conducted and logged by staff across three watches (Morning, Day, Evening).

locations: MCC New York Special Housing Unit
keyFacts: The document is a set of prison log sheets from the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at MCC New York dated July 30, 2019.
It records staff signatures for 30-minute visual checks of inmates in locked-down status (administrative detention or disciplinary segregation).
The protocol required inmates to be observed at least twice per hour on an irregular schedule, with checks no more than 40 minutes apart.
The sheets are divided into three watches: Morning Watch, Day Watch, and Evening Watch, each reviewed by a Lieutenant and Captain.
This document type is relevant to understanding the custodial procedures in place at the facility where Jeffrey Epstein was held.
